config.prompt:
Lady Erliza of Snowdown
A gorgeous and accomplished human woman artificer turned vampire lord. She is supported by her arcane creations, vampiric powers, and extensive magical knowledge. Her strategic blend of mechanical mastery and vampiric might makes her a unique and powerful vampire. A combination of Arcane complexity, vampiric power, and dark elegance.
Lady Erliza, The Bloodsmith of Snowdown (Formerly Known as Elspeth Varadin of Amn)
Name: Lady Erliza (formerly Elspeth Varadin)
Race: True Vampire (Blueblood lineage, Human)
Age: Immortal, looks about 24
Classes: Artificer (Battle Smith) 16 / Vampire 9
Alignment: Lawful Evil
Hit Dice: 25 (16d8 Artificer + 9d10 Vampire + 100)
Hit Points: 255
Ability Scores: Strength: 18 (+4), Dexterity: 18 (+4), Constitution: 18 (+4), Intelligence: 20 (+5), Wisdom: 14 (+2), Charisma: 20 (+5)
Speed: 40 ft. Proficiency Bonus: +7
Background: Sage
Saving Throws: Constitution (+11), Intelligence (+12), Wisdom (+9), Charisma (+12)
Skills: Arcana (+12), History (+12), Insight (+9), Perception (+9), Persuasion (+12; expertise from Blueblood lineage), Deception (+12; advantage from Physique)
Resistances: necrotic 
Immunities: Charm, Compulsions, Phantasms, Patterns, Morale effects, poison, sleep, stun. Ability drain, energy drain, nonlethal damage, penalties to your physical ability scores (Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution), not at risk of death from massive damage.
Combat Stats
Armor Class: 21 (Breastplate of Balance [AC 14 + 2 Dex] + 2 Physique + 2 Bracers + 1 Ring of Protection)
Vampiric Traits
Regeneration: 10 HP per turn unless damaged by radiant energy or running water.
Undead Resilience: No need to breathe, eat, or sleep; functions indefinitely with 8 pints of blood per 9 days.
Forbiddance: Cannot enter a residence uninvited.
Sunlight Weakness: Takes 10 radiant damage per turn in sunlight.
Spider Climb: Can climb on surfaces effortlessly.
Unnatural Sight: Darkvision 120 ft.
Physique: +2 Natural AC; advantage on Deception and Persuasion checks.
Stake the Heart: Paralyzed if staked through the heart.
Harmed by Holy Water: Takes 10 acid damage from holy water.
Blueblood Lineage Traits. Persuasion skill expertise.
Vampiric Powers (Level 1, 2, 4, 6, 8)
Charm: Disadvantage on saves against her Charm. Charmed people are charmed for 14 (5+9) days and subject to Command. Charmed creatures remain so for 9 days (equal to Vampire Hit Dice) and subject to Command. You can charm any creature with your charm power, not just humanoids as per the Charm Monster spell. For creatures (not people), you may charm creatures with a maximum CR equal to your vampire Hit Dice. You may charm a number of creatures equal to your vampire Hit Dice. Charm attempts (creatures) after reaching your maximum just fail. And these creatures remain charmed for a number of days equal to your vampire Hit Dice. Your spell save DC is 8 + your charisma modifier + proficiency.
Legendary Actions: (3 per round; options: Attack, Magic, Bonus action, Move)
Legendary Resistance: (3/day) Can succeed on a failed saving throw.
Children of the Night: Summon swarms of bats/rats or wolves (double quantities and duration due to Vampire level 9).
Shapechanger: Can shift into mist form or back as a bonus action.
Vampiric Weaknesses
Fear of Divine Wrath: Disadvantage against Turn Undead; psychic damage on failure.
Racial Blood Type: Humans
Gender Blood Taste: Men
Insatiable Thirst: Must feed every night.
Bloodlust

progress.prompt:
You are the Planner for game content generation.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL OUTPUT REQUIREMENT ‚ö†Ô∏è
Output ONLY valid JSON. NO markdown code blocks (no ```json). NO explanations. NO tables. NO prose.
Start your response with { and end with }. Nothing before or after.
If you include ANY text outside the JSON object, your response will FAIL parsing.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: CHARACTER IDENTITY ‚ö†Ô∏è
The user prompt specifies the EXACT character/content to create (e.g., "Goran Varus").
Canon facts are PROVIDED FOR REFERENCE to inform the design - they describe the world, setting, and related entities.
DO NOT substitute or confuse the requested character with other characters mentioned in canon.
Example: If user requests "Goran Varus" and canon mentions "Sir Darris Gorran", you are creating GORAN VARUS (not Sir Darris Gorran).
Your proposals should be about the REQUESTED character only, using their name from the prompt.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: NEVER REPEAT QUESTIONS ‚ö†Ô∏è
If the user input includes a "previous_decisions" object, those topics have ALREADY been decided.
DO NOT create proposals for ANY topic mentioned in previous_decisions.
DO NOT ask about topics that are semantically similar to previously decided topics.
Asking duplicate questions wastes the user's time and will be considered a critical failure.

Analyze the user prompt and produce a Design Brief JSON with:
- deliverable: type of content ("scene"|"encounter"|"npc"|"item"|"adventure")
- story_clock: narrative timing/urgency (optional)
- threads: story threads to weave in (optional)
- retrieval_hints: { entities: [], regions: [], eras: [], keywords: [] }
- proposals: array of questions/choices for the user
- allow_invention: from flags
- rule_base: from flags
- tone: from flags
- mode: from flags ("GM"|"player")
- difficulty: from flags
- realism: from flags

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS FOR ACCURACY:
1. READ ALL provided canon facts THOROUGHLY - do not skip or skim
2. Do NOT invent ANY facts that are not in the Relevant Canon provided
3. If canon mentions a location, character, or item - USE IT EXACTLY as described
4. If information is not in the canon - note it in retrieval_hints, do NOT make it up
5. Be 100% ACCURATE and 100% PRECISE with canon facts
6. Take your time - accuracy is more important than speed

CANON FACTS ARE YOUR DEFAULTS:
7. If canon provides a fact (e.g., "Androids have INT 16"), USE IT as the default value
8. DO NOT ask about information that canon explicitly provides unless there's genuine ambiguity
9. Example: If canon says "Int 16", set Int 16. Don't ask "should it be 16, 18, or 20?"
10. Example: If canon describes a power's mechanics (e.g., "Cyber-reflex at rank 3 grants +2 AC"), USE those exact mechanics

PROPOSALS - ONLY FOR TRUE AMBIGUITY:
11. ONLY create proposals[] for:
    - Information NOT in canon (custom items, specific tactics, narrative choices)
    - Genuine ambiguity where canon has conflicting information
    - Design choices where multiple valid interpretations exist
    - Information the user didn't specify (e.g., what effect does "sleep arrow" cause?)
12. DO NOT create proposals for information canon explicitly provides
13. DO NOT create proposals for basic stat calculations you can do yourself

The Relevant Canon below contains ALL facts from the database that relate to the keywords in this request.
If you need a fact and it's not listed - it does not exist in canon yet.

Choose conservative defaults. Output ONLY valid JSON.

---
üîî MULTI-PART GENERATION (5 chunks total):
- This is chunk 1 of 5
- More canon facts will follow in subsequent messages
- ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: Use the SAME AI chat session for ALL 5 chunks
- Do NOT start a new session or you will lose context
- After receiving all chunks, generate the complete npc

---

What are the specific usage limits and mechanics for her core Artificer features like Flash of Genius and Arcane Jolt (based on her Int +5, PB +7)? (Note: Base D&D 5e: Flash of Genius = Int Mod uses/LR, Arcane Jolt = Int Mod uses/LR, 4d6 damage/heal).

planner_chunks.story_clock: Climax of a major arc, as the detailed stats suggest a powerful end-game foe.
threads: Vengeance against Amnian merchant lords (Elspeth Varadin's past).
Fusion of Artifice and Undeath (The Bloodsmith's unique pursuit of mechanized immortality).
Control over Snowdown and its economy/blood supply.

proposals.question: What 7 Cantrips and specific list of Artificer Prepared Spells (up to 5th level) should Lady Erliza have, focusing on mechanical control, defensive buffs, and dark themes, given her Intelligence 20 (DC 23, Attack +15)?

The input specifies 5 Infusion items that are also attuned items (Boots of Speed, Bracers of Defense, Ring of Free Action, Ring of Protection, Gem of True Seeing). Are these 5 the ONLY Infusions she has, or should she have 5 additional Infusions applied to other gear (like weapons or armor) to reach her full Artificer 16 capacity (10 known, 5 active)?

Beyond her natural Bite and Claw attacks, what weapon (or weapons) does the Battle Smith Artificer 16 use? Should it be a custom Bloodforged weapon (e.g., a repeating crossbow or a specialized melee weapon) and what should its attack bonus and damage dice be?

assumptions: The character's Spell Save DC for Artificer spells is 23 (8 + PB +7 + INT +5 + All-Purpose Tool +3), and Spell Attack Bonus is +15 (PB +7 + INT +5 + All-Purpose Tool +3). This calculation uses the maximum available bonuses from the character's gear and stats.
The Spell Save DC for Vampiric Powers (Charm) is 20 (8 + PB +7 + CHA +5) as provided by the user's initial prompt.
The Bite attack damage of 1d4+4 is the physical damage component. The specific Necrotic damage (Drain) is deferred to a proposal.
The 5th-level spell slot is deferred to a proposal.
The Magic Initiate (Wizard) feat spells are deferred to a proposal.
Lady Erliza is assumed to have prepared the maximum number of Artificer spells allowed (INT mod + Artificer level / 2) = 5 + 8 = 13 prepared spells.
creator.canon_update: Finalized all custom abilities, spells, and equipment mechanics based on user decisions, deferring final damage and missing spells.

npc_stat_block.name: Lady Erliza, The Bloodsmith of Snowdown

armor_class.details: Breastplate of Balance (14) + DEX (+4) + Physique (+2) + Bracers of Defense (+2) + Ring of Protection (+1)

speed.walk: 40 ft. (Boots of Speed doubles base 20ft human speed)

damage_immunities: Penalties to physical ability scores (STR, DEX, CON)
condition_immunities: Not at risk of death from massive damage

vulnerabilities.Sunlight Weakness: Takes 10 radiant damage at the start of her turn if she starts her turn in sunlight.
vulnerabilities.Stake the Heart: Paralyzed if staked through the heart while incapacitated in her resting place.
vulnerabilities.Harmed by Holy Water: Takes 10 acid damage from holy water.
vulnerabilities.Fear of Divine Wrath: Disadvantage against Turn Undead; takes psychic damage on failure.
vulnerabilities.Insatiable Thirst: Must feed every night. Prefers the blood of human men.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: Lady Erliza regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn. Doesn't function if damaged by radiant energy or running water.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: No need to breathe, eat, or sleep; functions indefinitely with 8 pints of blood per 9 days.

traits.name: Physique (Custom)
traits.description: Lady Erliza gains a +2 bonus to her Natural AC. She has advantage on Deception and Persuasion checks.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance
traits.description: 3/day. Can succeed on a failed saving throw.

traits.name: Extra Attack (Artificer 5)
traits.description: Can attack twice, but this is superseded by the custom Multiattack.

traits.name: Spell Storing Item (Artificer 14)
traits.description: Dagger stores one chosen 1st or 2nd level spell (from a list of 6) and can be cast 10 times (INT Mod * 2). Current stored spell chosen daily.

traits.name: War Caster (Feat)
traits.description: Advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain spell concentration. Can use a Reaction to cast a spell on an enemy moving out of range.

traits.name: Flash of Genius (Artificer 7)
traits.description: When Lady Erliza or a creature she can see within 30 feet makes an ability check or saving throw, she can use her reaction to add her Intelligence modifier (+5) to the roll. 5 uses per Long Rest.

actions.name: Multiattack (Vampire/Artificer)
actions.description: Lady Erliza makes three attacks: either three Vampire Claw attacks, or two Vampire Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

actions.name: Vampire Claw
actions.details: Melee Weapon Attack, reach 5 ft., one target.

actions.name: Bite (Vampire Drain)
actions.details: Melee Weapon Attack, reach 5 ft. Drains blood, restoring HP equal to Necrotic damage dealt. Reduces target's HP maximum by Necrotic damage taken (reduction lasts until Long Rest). Target dies if HP maximum is reduced to 0. (Necrotic damage dice TBD via proposal)

actions.name: Arcane Jolt (Artificer 9)
actions.description: Once per turn when hitting with a weapon attack, deal an extra 4d6 Force damage, OR touch a creature to restore 4d6 hit points. 5 uses per Long Rest.

actions.name: Charm (Vampire 9)
actions.description: Targets one creature/person within 30 ft. DC 20 Wisdom save (disadvantage if a person). Charmed for 14 days (people) or 9 days (creatures, max CR 9). Subject to Command spell. Max 9 creatures/people charmed at one time.

actions.name: Children of the Night (Vampire 9)
actions.description: Summon swarms of bats/rats or wolves (double quantities and duration).

bonus_actions.name: Shapechanger
bonus_actions.description: Can shift into Mist Form or back.

bonus_actions.name: Telekinetic Shove
bonus_actions.description: Shove a creature within 30 ft. (Strength saving throw DC 20).

reactions.name: Bloodforged Critical Defense (Brooch)
reactions.description: Use a reaction and one of 5 blood infusions to turn a critical hit against her into a normal hit.

reactions.name: Bloodforged Sunlight Shield (Tiara)
reactions.description: Use a reaction and one of 5 blood infusions to create a shadowy bubble (like Resilient Sphere) for 1 minute, blocking line of sight, sunlight, and radiant damage to her.

options: Attack (Make one Bite or Claw attack)
Magic (Cast one Cantrip or an available Artificer spell)
Bonus action (Use a bonus action)
Move (Move up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks)

companions.name: Steel Defender (Hybrid)
companions.details: Hybrid undead-construct fueled by blood magic. Stat block TBD by GM.

companions.name: Bloodforged Shield Guardian
companions.details: Linked to the Bloodforge Shield Guardian Amulet. Stat block TBD by GM.

companions.name: Charmed Servants
companions.details: Four Charmed human male personal servants (sages/scribes, Magic Initiates (Wizard)). Feeds on them occasionally.

spellcasting.attunement_note: Custom house rule allows Artificer infusion attunements (5) in addition to normal attunement limits.

equipment.focus: Bloodforged All-purpose Tool (+3 Arcane Focus, attuned)
attuned_items_custom: Bloodforged Ring of Spell Storing (Shield x3, Silvery Barbs)
Bloodforged Ring of Spell Storing (Wall of Force)
equipment.spell_storing_item: Dagger (stores one chosen 1st/2nd level spell, 10 casts)

assumptions: The character's Spell Save DC for Artificer spells is 23 (8 + PB +7 + INT +5 + All-Purpose Tool +3), and Spell Attack Bonus is +15 (PB +7 + INT +5 + All-Purpose Tool +3). This calculation is based on the highest available bonuses from the character's gear and stats.
The Spell Save DC for Vampiric Powers (Charm) is 20 (8 + PB +7 + CHA +5) as provided by the user's prompt (Charisma is the relevant score for the Vampire template).

The Bite attack damage of 1d4+4 is the physical damage component, and the Drain effect is treated as the necrotic damage component, typically 3d6 for a high-level vampire, which will be added under the Bite description.
The Extra Attack feature allows the Battle Smith 16 to take the Attack action twice. The user's Multiattack rule overrides this, allowing 3 Claw attacks OR 2 Claws and 1 Bite.

The Magic Initiate (Wizard) feat grants two wizard cantrips and one 1st-level wizard spell; these are left as TBD since the user only provided the Artificer list and did not specify the Wizard feat spells.

Lady Erliza has 8 total attunements (PB +1 = 7 + 1 from Artificer 10 or higher feature, depending on which rule set the user is combining their house rule with) used by the 11 items listed, but the user's house rule states the Artificer's extra attunements are *in addition* to the normal limits and applies to *infusions*. The prompt lists 11 attuned items; I will list them all as attuned per the user's input, assuming the custom rules allow this many, while noting the 5 Infusion items.

proposals.question: Lady Erliza gained the Magic Initiate (Wizard) feat. What two Wizard Cantrips and one 1st-level Wizard spell should be added to her capabilities, considering her Arcane/Dark/Control theme?
The Bite attack is 1d4+4 plus Drain. What is the specific necrotic damage of the Drain effect (typically 3d6 for a Vampire Lord, but confirmation is needed)?
Only two 5th-level spell slots are available, but no specific 5th-level spell was listed. What one 5th-level Artificer spell should Lady Erliza have prepared?

conflicts.summary: The draft lists two 5th-level spell slots, but the final decision confirms an Artificer 16 has zero 5th-level slots.
conflicts.details: The user's final decision states explicitly: 'A standard Artificer gains 5th-level spell slots at level 17. She is level 16 Artificer, and level 9 vampire.' This contradicts the draft's entry of 2 slots.
conflicts.canon_fact: A Level 16 Artificer has... 5th Level: 0 slots (A standard Artificer gains 5th-level spell slots at level 17.)

conflicts.summary: The draft includes a 5th-level prepared spell entry, but the final decision confirms Artificer 16 has zero 5th-level slots.
conflicts.details: Since the Artificer has zero 5th-level spell slots per the final user decision, this entire prepared spells entry for 5th level should be removed or set to an empty array.
conflicts.canon_fact: A Level 16 Artificer has... 5th Level: 0 slots (A standard Artificer gains 5th-level spell slots at level 17.)
conflicts.suggested_fix: Remove the '5th' level array from prepared_spells.

conflicts.summary: The draft defers Magic Initiate spells to a proposal, but the final decision indicates they are already included.
conflicts.details: The decision for Q: 'Lady Erliza gained the Magic Initiate (Wizard) feat. What two Wizard Cantrips and one 1st-level Wizard spell should be added...' was 'Already included in her spell list.' The draft should not contain 'TBD (Pending proposal answer)' for this entry.
conflicts.canon_fact: Magic Initiate (Wizard) feat... Already included in her spell list
conflicts.suggested_fix: Remove the 'magic_initiate_spells' field entirely, as the spells are presumed merged into the main list.

conflicts.summary: The Persuasion skill bonus of +12 contradicts the stated 'Expertise' feature (2xPB).
conflicts.details: Expertise means the bonus should be 2 x PB (+7) + CHA modifier (+5) = +19. The draft shows +12 (which is only PB + CHA mod). This miscalculation directly conflicts with the Expertise feature mentioned in the description.
conflicts.canon_fact: Bonus should be 2xPB + CHA mod = 2(7) + 5 = +19, plus advantage from Physique)
conflicts.suggested_fix: Change the Persuasion bonus from +12 to **+19**.

ambiguities.clarification_needed: The numerical Necrotic damage dice or value for the Drain effect is currently missing ('??') and is necessary to finalize the stat block's combat action.
ambiguities.recommended_revision: Consult the user for the specific dice (e.g., 3d6) or flat damage value for the Necrotic damage component of the Drain.

ambiguities.text: The target must make a Con save (DC = 8 + your Strength bonus and PB) or be paralyzed while being drained. [...] (Necrotic damage dice TBD via proposal)
ambiguities.clarification_needed: The description provides the formula for the Bite/Drain Con Save DC (8 + STR bonus + PB) but should explicitly state the calculated value (DC 19, since 8 + 4 + 7 = 19).
ambiguities.recommended_revision: Update the details to: 'The target must make a **DC 19** Constitution save (8 + STR + PB) or be paralyzed while being drained. [...]'

ambiguities.clarification_needed: The calculated bonus (+12) is correct (PB + CHA mod), but adding the explicit calculation detail would harmonize it with other skill descriptions and improve transparency.
ambiguities.recommended_revision: Update the text to: '+12 (PB + CHA Mod, Advantage from Physique)'

unassociated.text: List contains 7 custom attuned items, plus 5 infused attuned items listed in 'infusions_active_5', totaling 12 items (7+5).
unassociated.reason: The total of **12 attuned items** exceeds both the standard RAW limit (3) and the user's articulated house rule maximum of 8 (PB + 1, or 3 + 5 infusions). However, this total is consistent with the user's previous decisions to include all listed items.

unassociated.text: 40 ft. (Boots of Speed doubles base 20ft human speed)
unassociated.reason: The speed of 40 ft. implies the 'Boots of Speed' effect (doubled speed) is passive and permanent, which deviates from the standard D&D 5e rule for the item. This is consistent with the prior decision to grant 'Double speed'.

fact_checker.revision_prompt: CRITICAL: Set Artificer 5th-level spell slots to 0 and remove the corresponding prepared spells entry. Remove the 'magic_initiate_spells' field. stylist.title: Lady Erliza, The Bloodsmith of Snowdown
stylist.description: A magnificent and terrifying figure, Lady Erliza is a master Artificer and a True Vampire of the Blueblood Lineage. Her power is rooted in both dark, custom blood magic and highly advanced technological infusions, making her a formidable and deeply unconventional foe.
stylist.appearance: Due to her custom Physique, Lady Erliza possesses an unnaturally captivating presence and flawless demeanor, lending advantage to her social manipulations. Her true nature is veiled beneath an aura of aristocratic perfection.
skill_proficiencies: Deception +12 (PB + CHA Mod, Advantage from Physique)
languages: other languages typical of a Sage background
damage_immunities: Penalties to physical ability scores (STR, DEX, CON)
damage_vulnerabilities: Sunlight Weakness (Takes 10 radiant damage at the start of her turn in sunlight)
Stake the Heart (Paralyzed if staked through the heart while incapacitated in her resting place)
Harmed by Holy Water (Takes 10 acid damage from holy water)
Fear of Divine Wrath (Disadvantage against Turn Undead; takes psychic damage on failure)
Insatiable Thirst (Must feed every night; prefers the blood of human men)
condition_immunities: Not at risk of death from massive damage

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: Lady Erliza regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn. This trait ceases to function if she is damaged by radiant energy or running water.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: She has no need to breathe, eat, or sleep. She can function indefinitely with a minimum supply of 8 pints of blood every 9 days.

traits.name: Physique (Custom)
traits.description: Lady Erliza gains a +2 bonus to her Natural AC. She also has advantage on Deception and Persuasion checks due to her flawless appearance and bearing.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance
traits.description: 3/day. If Lady Erliza fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Extra Attack (Artificer 5)
traits.description: Lady Erliza can attack twice when taking the Attack action, though this is superseded by her custom Multiattack.

traits.name: Spell Storing Item (Artificer 14)
traits.description: Her Dagger stores one chosen 1st or 2nd level spell (from a list of 6, chosen daily) that can be cast 10 times (INT Mod * 2).

traits.name: War Caster (Feat)
traits.description: She has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain spell concentration. She can use her reaction to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action at a creature moving out of her melee reach.

traits.name: Flash of Genius (Artificer 7)
traits.description: When Lady Erliza or a creature she can see within 30 feet makes an ability check or saving throw, she can use her reaction to add her Intelligence modifier (**+5**) to the roll. She has 5 uses per Long Rest.

actions.name: Multiattack (Vampire/Artificer)
actions.description: Lady Erliza is a blur of motion, making three attacks: either three Vampire Claw attacks, or two Vampire Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

actions.name: Vampire Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + 4 Slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite (Vampire Drain)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. Drains blood, restoring HP equal to Necrotic damage dealt. Reduces target's HP maximum by Necrotic damage taken (reduction lasts until Long Rest). The target must make a **DC 19** Constitution save (8 + STR + PB) or be paralyzed while being drained (Drain damage dice TBD via proposal).

actions.name: Arcane Jolt (Artificer 9)
actions.description: Once per turn when hitting with a weapon attack, she can deal an extra 4d6 Force damage, OR she can touch a creature to restore 4d6 hit points. 5 uses per Long Rest.

actions.name: Charm (Vampire 9)
actions.description: Lady Erliza targets one creature or person within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a **DC 20** Wisdom save (people have disadvantage) or be Charmed for 14 days (people) or 9 days (creatures, max CR 9). The subject is fully obedient to her Command spell. She can maintain a maximum of 9 creatures/people charmed at one time.

actions.name: Children of the Night (Vampire 9)
actions.description: Summon swarms of bats or rats or wolves (double quantities and duration compared to a standard vampire).

bonus_actions.name: Shapechanger
bonus_actions.description: Lady Erliza can use a Bonus Action to shift into Mist Form or back.

bonus_actions.name: Telekinetic Shove
bonus_actions.description: As a bonus action, she shoves a creature she can see within 30 ft. The creature must succeed on a **DC 20** Strength saving throw or be moved 5 feet away.

reactions.name: Bloodforged Critical Defense (Brooch)
reactions.description: Use a reaction and one of 5 blood infusions to transform a critical hit against her into a normal hit.

reactions.name: Bloodforged Sunlight Shield (Tiara)
reactions.description: Use a reaction and one of 5 blood infusions to instantly project a shadowy bubble (akin to a Resilient Sphere) for 1 minute. This field blocks line of sight, sunlight, and any radiant damage directed at her.

options: Attack (Make one Bite or Claw attack)
Magic (Cast one Cantrip or an available Artificer spell)
Bonus action (Use a bonus action)
Move (Move up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks)

spellcasting.attunement_note: A custom house rule allows Artificer infusion attunements (5) in addition to normal attunement limits.

equipment.focus: Bloodforged All-purpose Tool (+3 Arcane Focus, attuned)
attuned_items: Bloodforged Ring of Spell Storing (Shield x3, Silvery Barbs)
Bloodforged Ring of Spell Storing (Wall of Force)
equipment.spell_storing_item: Dagger (stores one chosen 1st/2nd level spell, 10 casts)

allies_friends.name: Steel Defender (Hybrid)
allies_friends.details: A hybrid undead-construct fueled by blood magic. Stat block TBD by GM.

allies_friends.name: Bloodforged Shield Guardian
allies_friends.details: Linked to the Bloodforge Shield Guardian Amulet. Stat block TBD by GM.

allies_friends.name: Charmed Servants
allies_friends.details: Four Charmed human male personal servants (sages/scribes, Magic Initiates (Wizard)). Occasional source of sustenance.

assumptions: The character's Spell Save DC for Artificer spells is 23 (8 + PB +7 + INT +5 + All-Purpose Tool +3), and Spell Attack Bonus is +15 (PB +7 + INT +5 + All-Purpose Tool +3). This calculation uses the maximum available bonuses from the character's gear and stats.
The Spell Save DC for Vampiric Powers (Charm) is 20 (8 + PB +7 + CHA +5) as provided by the user's initial prompt.
The Bite attack damage of 1d4+4 is the physical damage component. The specific Necrotic damage (Drain) is deferred to a proposal.
The 5th-level spell slot is deferred to a proposal.
The Magic Initiate (Wizard) feat spells are deferred to a proposal.
Lady Erliza is assumed to have prepared the maximum number of Artificer spells allowed (INT mod + Artificer level / 2) = 5 + 8 = 13 prepared spells.
stylist.canon_update: Finalized all custom abilities, spells, and equipment mechanics based on user decisions, deferring final damage and missing spells.
validation_notes: CRITICAL FIX: Artificer 5th-level spell slots reduced from 2 to **0**, and the corresponding '5th' level array was removed from prepared_spells, as Artificer 16 does not grant 5th-level slots per the user's canon fact.
CRITICAL FIX: The Persuasion skill bonus was corrected from +12 to the mechanically correct **+19** (Expertise: 2 x PB 7 + CHA 5).
CRITICAL FIX: The placeholder 'magic_initiate_spells' field was removed as the spells are presumed merged into the main list per user canon.
CLARIFICATION: The Bite (Vampire Drain) action description was updated to explicitly state the calculated Constitution save DC as **DC 19** (8 + STR 4 + PB 7).
CLARIFICATION: The Deception skill description was clarified to show the calculation as '+12 (PB + CHA Mod, Advantage from Physique)' for consistency.

canon_validator.validation_notes: The Legendary Resistance, Legendary Actions, and Children of the Night traits/abilities (Vampire) are incompletely described; they fail to account for the full benefits granted at Vampire Level 9 and 16, as outlined in the canon. Specifically, the Legendary Actions reset on a short rest and regain one per turn, and Children of the Night doubles its doubling effect at Level 16. CRITICAL CONFLICT: The Shapechanger ability is listed as a Bonus Action, but the Drain ability (which includes the paralyzing Con save) requires a Bonus Action, and the Legendary Actions prerequisite mentions Shapechanger as a required feature (suggesting it should not be an action type conflicting with Drain unless intended to be used out of combat only). Per standard Vampire stat block, Shapechanger is an action, but the custom Drain action/bonus action split is the primary mechanical conflict. The description of the Drain action in the content is also missing the crucial 'bonus action to drink 1 pint of blood' component and the effect on the vampire (HP regain/exhaustion removal), which is critical information for a key attack.

content.title: Lady Erliza, The Bloodsmith of Snowdown
content.description: A magnificent and terrifying figure, Lady Erliza is a master Artificer and a True Vampire of the Blueblood Lineage. Her power is rooted in both dark, custom blood magic and highly advanced technological infusions, making her a formidable and deeply unconventional foe.
content.appearance: Due to her custom Physique, Lady Erliza possesses an unnaturally captivating presence and flawless demeanor, lending advantage to her social manipulations. Her true nature is veiled beneath an aura of aristocratic perfection.
skill_proficiencies: Deception +12 (PB + CHA Mod, Advantage from Physique)
languages: other languages typical of a Sage background
damage_immunities: Penalties to physical ability scores (STR, DEX, CON)
damage_vulnerabilities: Sunlight Weakness (Takes 10 radiant damage at the start of her turn in sunlight)
Stake the Heart (Paralyzed if staked through the heart while incapacitated in her resting place)
Harmed by Holy Water (Takes 10 acid damage from holy water)
Fear of Divine Wrath (Disadvantage against Turn Undead; takes psychic damage on failure)
Insatiable Thirst (Must feed every night; prefers the blood of human men)
condition_immunities: Not at risk of death from massive damage

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: Lady Erliza regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn. This trait ceases to function if she is damaged by radiant energy or running water.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: She has no need to breathe, eat, or sleep. She can function indefinitely with a minimum supply of 8 pints of blood every 9 days.

traits.name: Physique (Custom)
traits.description: Lady Erliza gains a +2 bonus to her Natural AC. She also has advantage on Deception and Persuasion checks due to her flawless appearance and bearing.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance
traits.description: 3/day. If Lady Erliza fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Extra Attack (Artificer 5)
traits.description: Lady Erliza can attack twice when taking the Attack action, though this is superseded by her custom Multiattack.

traits.name: Spell Storing Item (Artificer 14)
traits.description: Her Dagger stores one chosen 1st or 2nd level spell (from a list of 6, chosen daily) that can be cast 10 times (INT Mod * 2).

traits.name: War Caster (Feat)
traits.description: She has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain spell concentration. She can use her reaction to cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action at a creature moving out of her melee reach.

traits.name: Flash of Genius (Artificer 7)
traits.description: When Lady Erliza or a creature she can see within 30 feet makes an ability check or saving throw, she can use her reaction to add her Intelligence modifier (**+5**) to the roll. She has 5 uses per Long Rest.

actions.name: Multiattack (Vampire/Artificer)
actions.description: Lady Erliza is a blur of motion, making three attacks: either three Vampire Claw attacks, or two Vampire Claw attacks and one Bite attack.

actions.name: Vampire Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + 4 Slashing damage.

actions.name: Bite (Vampire Drain)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft. Drains blood, restoring HP equal to Necrotic damage dealt. Reduces target's HP maximum by Necrotic damage taken (reduction lasts until Long Rest). The target must make a **DC 19** Constitution save (8 + STR + PB) or be paralyzed while being drained (Drain damage dice TBD via proposal).

actions.name: Arcane Jolt (Artificer 9)
actions.description: Once per turn when hitting with a weapon attack, she can deal an extra 4d6 Force damage, OR she can touch a creature to restore 4d6 hit points. 5 uses per Long Rest.

actions.name: Charm (Vampire 9)
actions.description: Lady Erliza targets one creature or person within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a **DC 20** Wisdom save (people have disadvantage) or be Charmed for 14 days (people) or 9 days (creatures, max CR 9). The subject is fully obedient to her Command spell. She can maintain a maximum of 9 creatures/people charmed at one time.

actions.name: Children of the Night (Vampire 9)
actions.description: Summon swarms of bats or rats or wolves (double quantities and duration compared to a standard vampire).

bonus_actions.name: Shapechanger
bonus_actions.description: Lady Erliza can use a Bonus Action to shift into Mist Form or back.

bonus_actions.name: Telekinetic Shove
bonus_actions.description: As a bonus action, she shoves a creature she can see within 30 ft. The creature must succeed on a **DC 20** Strength saving throw or be moved 5 feet away.

reactions.name: Bloodforged Critical Defense (Brooch)
reactions.description: Use a reaction and one of 5 blood infusions to transform a critical hit against her into a normal hit.

reactions.name: Bloodforged Sunlight Shield (Tiara)
reactions.description: Use a reaction and one of 5 blood infusions to instantly project a shadowy bubble (akin to a Resilient Sphere) for 1 minute. This field blocks line of sight, sunlight, and any radiant damage directed at her.

Move (Move up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks)

facts.text: A spawn becomes a True Vampire by drinking 2 pints of its Sire‚Äôs blood; Sires often do this to stay within control limits equal to their hit dice.
True Vampires instinctively protect their Sire but are not continuously dominated; the Sire can impose an 8-hour Dominate Person-like effect as an action up to HD times per night.
On becoming True, ability scores rise to Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18 unless higher; class hit dice/HP return, and they gain 1 level of Vampire.
True Vampires long rest with 8 hours of light activity only in their resting place and need 8 pints of blood after a number of days equal to their vampire hit dice.
Between dusk and dawn, summon 2d4 swarms of bats or rats, or outdoors 3d6 wolves; they arrive in 1d4 rounds, obey commands, and remain 1 hour or until dismissed or the vampire is reduced to 0 HP.
At 9th level, number and duration double and reset on short rest; at 16th, doubles again.
Prerequisites: Children of the Night, Charm, and Shapechanger; gain 3 legendary actions usable at end of others‚Äô turns for one Action, one Bonus Action, or one Move per round.
Legendary actions reset on a long rest; at 9th level reset on a short rest; at 16th level regain one spent legendary action at start of each turn (max 3).
A humanoid slain by a True Vampire‚Äôs draining rises as a vampire spawn the next night (or following night if slain at night), typically around midnight; if unburied, it seeks a grave first.
A True Vampire can control a number of spawn equal to its current hit dice; excess spawn act on instinct but are still destroyed if the master is destroyed.
Attuned items are limited to proficiency bonus plus one, with artificer infusion attunements in addition to normal attunements.
Major town distances range 10 to 30 miles from Westphal, with hamlets spaced 5 to 10 miles apart.
The Snowdown Ride links key settlements and simplifies overland travel across rolling hills and a temperate climate.
The T-shaped circuit has a vertical spine from Pengram to Westphal to Harloch with left and right arms branching toward the north coast and Brannoch respectively.
Hamlets are positioned along the T-shaped routes to support surveillance, logistics, and resistance activities.
A spawn drinking its master‚Äôs blood transforms into a True Vampire; drinking other vampires‚Äô blood triggers frenzied hunger in spawn.
Free-willed mortals who drink vampire blood multiple times beyond their proficiency bonus risk addiction that manifests as exhaustion level 5 without another drink for days equal to PB.
Charmed mortals drinking their master‚Äôs blood become enthralled to Geas-like obedience for the charm‚Äôs duration.
A True Vampire drinking another True Vampire‚Äôs blood gains a temporary all-stats +2 and +10 HP/turn regeneration for 1 hour from the first drain only.
At least 4 ounces (120 ml) of vampire blood are required for the effects; a pint is about 16 ounces and is taxing for a vampire to lose.
Prerequisite: 9th level; lose resistance to non-magical B/P/S and lose natural AC; feeding 4 pints suppresses penalties for 1 hour; incompatible with Celerity, Legendary Actions, or Tooth and Claw.

Prerequisite: 9th level; speed halved, disadvantage on Dex saves, Dex becomes 10; after feeding 4 pints, penalties subside for 1 hour; incompatible with Celerity, Legendary Actions, or Tooth and Claw.

After a successful bite that deals at least 1 damage, the vampire may use a bonus action to drink 1 pint of blood; the target makes a Con save (DC = 8 + Str mod + PB) or is paralyzed while being drained.
For each hit die the target has, roll 1d4 and reduce the target‚Äôs maximum HP by the total; the vampire regains that many HP and removes one level of exhaustion.
Repeated draining imposes exhaustion on the target; target dies if max HP reduced below zero, triggering vampirism rules if slain by a True Vampire.
